item.title: Benjamin add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The smallest minority on earth is the individual. Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Hell is empty and all the devils are here." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "A person who is nice to you, but rude to the waiter, is not a nice person." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "What do you despise? By this are you truly known." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "A process cannot be understood by stopping it. Understanding must move with the flow of the process, must join it and flow with it." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Richard Herley
item.description: "Man had created God in his own image, not the other way around. He had done it through sheer terror, and who could blame him? Unfortunately he had made too good a job. The god he had invented was just as cruel and careless as man himself. Not a deity to whom one should seriously address a prayer." -- Richard Herley

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Caleb Carr
item.description: "It is the greatest truth of our age: Information is not knowledge." -- Caleb Carr

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you." -- Stephen King

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It must be a fault in me that I am not gravely shocked at the sins of others unless they personally affect me." -- Somerset Maugham

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It is pleasure that lurks in the practice of every one of your virtues. Man performs actions because they are good for him, and when they are good for other people as well they are thought virtuous: if he finds pleasure in helping others he is benevolent; if he finds pleasure in working for society he is public-spirited; but it is for your private pleasure that you give twopence to a beggar as much as it is for my private pleasure that I drink another whiskey and soda. I, less of a humbug than you, neither applaud myself for my pleasure nor demand your admiration." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad." -- Neal Stephenson
